text:
getClass().getResource() returns a URL.
If the classpath contains spaces, these are encoded as %20.
This causes problems if the URL is converted to a String and used with the File class.

If the resource is being accessed for read, then it's better to use
getClass().getResourceAsStream() which avoids any problems with spaces.

This problem currently affects:
ApdexPerTransactionTest
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
URL: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=1790830&view=rev
Log:
getClass().getResource() does not work as a File if the classpath contains spaces
Bugzilla Id: 60966

Modified:
    jmeter/trunk/test/src/org/apache/jmeter/report/dashboard/ApdexPerTransactionTest.java

Note: there may be other instances of tests which use getResource()
creator: sebb@apache.org
sebb@apache.org
text:
If the file name is needed, then one can use:

java.nio.file.Paths.get(url.toURI());
